intro: Turraea ambohitsiana, commonly known as the Madagascar turraea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Turraea ambohitsiana is considered a rare and endemic species.
